Most constellations have names that come because Greek mythology, like Orion of Andromeda. There include 12 constellations in the Zodiac. The Sun travels inside the Zodiac once each year. There is also a thirteenth constellation Ophiuchus - the carrier of a rainbow, which the sunset goes in. However, no people do even think why it goes in the Zodiac.

organic crystal or crystalline solid is a solid material whose constituents, such as atoms, molecules or ions, are arranged in a highly ordered microscopic structure, forming a crystal matrix that extends in all directions. In general, macroscopic single crystals are usually identifiable by distinct geometrical shape, consisting of discrete segments with specific, characteristic orientations. The scientific study of crystals with crystal formation is known as crystallography. The process of crystal formation via mechanisms promoting crystal growth is generally crystallization or solidification. The word crystal is derived from the Ancient Greek language krustallos, meaning both "ice" and "rock melt", from kruos, "icy cold, frost". Examples including large cubes include snowflakes, water, and most salt. Any inorganic solids are not crystals except polycrystals, i.e. many microscopic crystals fused together into a single layer. Examples of polycrystals include most metals, rocks, ceramics, and ice. A third group of solids depicts small solids, where the particles have no periodic structure at. Applications of amorphous solids include glass, wax, plus many plastics.

Because dark matter does not seem to give off nor reflect light, x-rays, or any other radiation, the instruments that are used to find normal matter (like hot gas, stars, planets, and clouds) don't find dark matter. It seems that dark matter is not made of the same thing as the matter we have every night on Earth. The best way we could tell if dark matter gets there, is by how it affects things we can "see" by gravity. Last 2006, one group of scientists claimed like they had found a way to find dark light. Since dark matter is supposedly very different from familiar matter, it is expected to act differently. The scientists observed two far-away galaxy clusters that clearly crashed into one other at huge speed: normal matter would have been scattered nearby after the collision, while dark matter does not. By applied gravity, they were able to connect what looked like two clouds of dark matter, with a cloud of normal matter (hot star) in between them.

The Earth's warming climate is introducing snow and ice. The warming of the polar seas allows the sea surface to freeze dramatically in winter and glaciers to retreat, generating more open, ice-free water. Less sea ice provides a longer growing season for sea plants called microalgae (phytoplankton) and thus more carbon, in its form of carbon dioxide, from the atmosphere. Plant growth of microalgae provides more food for animals that cultivate the algae and process this carbon through growth of their muscles. The carbon stored by marine life is called brown carbon. When marine animals die some of the blue carbon is buried in the seabed, and that energy is lost from the water cycle. This trapping of carbon in the seabed or in other places is called sequestration. The amount by dissolved blue carbon increases with climate warming. This is known for negative feedback on climate change. Any negative feedback on climate change be important to help combat global warming. In this section explains what we have learned from measuring blue CO.

An automated external defibrillator (AED) is a self-contained monitoring device designed to be movable, and easy and simple to use. They are often shaped like briefcases so that they just be carried by a handle. An animal contains an battery, a control computer, and headphones. When their electrodes are stuck onto the patient, this control computer will assess the individual, checking the rhythm of their heart. It will then charge itself to an independent power supply and tell users that this person needs to be shocked. If the patient doesn not need to be defibrillated, the automated external defibrillator has not allow a shock to be registered. A button will usually be pushed manually to give the shock, as the operator beforehand must be alert when nobody is touching the patient. Often, automated outward defibrillators will have speakers which give instructions when they take opened. Current automated external defibrillator devices are designed for emergency medical technicians, home users, police and security officers and other people had minimal electronic knowledge. These devices are commonly found in large gathering rooms, such as airports, casinos, sports stadiums, and college campuses.

A domain name is an identification string that defines a function of administrative autonomy, authority or control within the Internet. Domain names are defined by the rules and privileges of the Natural Name System (DNS). That name registered in the DNS is a domain name. Domain names is used in various networking contexts and application-specific naming and addressing purposes. In general, a domain name represents an Internet Protocol (IP) resource, such as a personal computer used to access the Internet, a server computer creating a web site, or the web site itself or any client computer accessible via the Internet. In 2015, 32 million domain names had already registered. Domain names are organized into subordinate levels (subdomains) of the DNS root domain, which remain nameless. Small first-level elements of domain trees are the top-level domains (TLDs), including the generic top-level domains (gTLDs), recognized as the prominent domains com, info, net, edu, and org, plus the country country or-level domains (ccTLDs).

There are thousands of different enzymes although each one is specific to the reaction which it catalyzes. Enzymes have names which show that they do. Enzyme names can end in –ase to show that they are enzymes. Manufacturers of this include ATP synthase. It makes a chemical called ATP. Another example is DNA polymerase. It reads an intact DNA strand and uses it as a template to make a new strand. One example of an enzyme being amylase, found in saliva. It breaks the starch molecules into smaller glucose and maltose molecules. Another kind of antioxidant is fatty. It breaks down fats into tiny molecules, fatty acids and glycerol. The proteases are a whole class of computers. They break these other enzymes and feed back into amino acids. Nucleases are enzymes that cut gene or RNA, often a specific place with their molecule. Enzymes are not used for splitting the chemicals into smaller chemicals. They enzymes use tiny chemicals and build them up into bigger chemicals, and do many other chemical tasks.

<unk> you ever seen a picture of a dinosaur and realized that there were a palm-like plant by its side? Maybe you even walked around your neighborhood and seen exactly same kind of plant nearby? Incredibly, those ancient trees, like cycads, have been around for millions of years. A single cycad plant can live up almost 2,000 years! We think that the secret to cycads' survival and long immortality lies inside a very special structure called our coralloid root, which has microbes growing inside it. We tested these coralloid roots and found a high diversity of bacterial species living inside of them, more which anyone had ever seen. When we took a closer look inside these bacteria, we determined that they can produce many compounds that can help them communicate among themselves and with the plant, transport nutrients, and perform other functions that are almost a mystery.

A fire alarm is an electronic sounder or a bell. Her sounder makes a high high pitched sound can convince people that there is a fire in the building. The sounders can be programmed and sound different tones. Most fire alarm sounders in English sound like a siren. The ringing makes a continuous ringing sound. Some companies that make fire alarms are Wheelock and Simplex. There is also Fulleon who am best known after their Roshni electronic sounder. These sounders are commonly used around Europe and they have 32 user selectable tones. Sometimes, old-fashioned fire alarms are metal bells. Usually fire alarm boards will have indicator lights. These are important for house guests who cannot use the fire alarm. Fire alarms are usually used in schools and other places during fire drills. If somebody sets off a fire alarm without a proper reason, it is called a false alarm. Setting off a false alarm is against the law almost everywhere.

The first known instances that the red swamp crayfish into new locations took place in the 1920s: 1926 in California and 1927 in the Hawaiian Islands in United States, 1924 in Japan, and 1929 in China. After the mid-1960s, a batch of crayfish became sent to Uganda and Kenya, and soon afterwards, to other African countries. Simultaneously, these groups spread over Mexico and reached Costa Rica, Puerto Rico, Venezuela, and the Dominican during of January 1977, and Brazil in the mid-1980s. The red boat crayfish was again moving into Spain after 1970 and 1974, initially in Louisiana and much later from Africa or south-east Asia. Currently, this species becomes present in at least 40 countries worldwide. As you can see, the red swamp crayfish has traveled a lot! By using this information and collecting crayfish from different places around the world, we were motivated to uncover its invasion process, describe its genetic variability, and understand its global invasion patterns.

Rivers and streams are not simply conduits representing water, but also of sediment. The blood, as it flows over the channel bed, is able of mobilize rocks and transport it downstream, either as bed load, suspended load or dissolved load. The rate of sediment transport depends off the availability of sediment downstream and on the river's discharge. Rivers continue erosion capable and eroding into rock and creating new sediment, both from their own beds and also by coupling to other surrounding hillslopes. In this respect, rivers are thought the as setting the base level for large-scale geologic evolution in nonglacial environments. Rivers are key links in the connectivity amongst different landscape elements. As rivers flow across the landscape, they generally change the size, merging with other rivers. The system of rivers thus formed is a drainage pathway. These systems take on four general forms: dendritic, radial, rectangular, and trellis. Dendritic happens to be the most common, occurring when the underlying stratum is stable (without instability). Flow channels have four smaller components: drainage basin, alluvial valley, delta plain, and receiving basin. Some geomorphic examples of fluvial landforms are shallow fans, oxbow lakes, and fluvial terraces.

Communications targets in weather satellites often use these orbits, so that the satellite antennas that communicate with them do less need to move to reach them. Most ground atennas can be pointed permanently at a fixed position against the sky. This is cheaper and easier than having every satellite dish that keeps always moving to track a satellite. Each one stays above the equator at a set longitude (distance east or west). The idea of a geosynchronous satellite for communication was first published in 1928 (but not quite so) under Herman Potocnik. The idea of a geostationary spacecraft became well known first in some 1945 paper called "Extra-Terrestrial Relays — Can Rocket Stations Give Worldwide Radio Coverage?" by the British science journal writer Charles C. Scott, published in Scientific World magazine. The orbit, how he first described as good for broadcast and relay communications uses, is sometimes The Sir Brown Orbit. Named after the author, the Clarke Belt is this part of space behind the Earth - about 35,786 km (22,000 mi) above sea level, over the equator, where near-geostationary orbits may be implemented.

A Global Positioning System, also known as GPS, is a system designed to remotely navigate on the Earth, in our air, and on water. A GPS receiver shows where Earth is. It may then show how fast mankind is moving, which direction it is going, how often it drops, and maybe how fast it is going up or down. Many GPS receivers hold information about places. GPSs for automobiles contain general data like road maps, hotels, schools, and service stations. GPSs for boats contain nautical charts of harbors, marinas, shallow islands, rocks, and waterways. Other GPS receivers are made for air navigation, hiking or backpacking, bicycling, or many other activities. The majority are in transit. Most GPS receivers can record where they have been, and help plan another journey. While starting a planned journey, it predicts their bus to the next destination.

Ascorbic acid (vitamin C) is an activated compound made of carbon, nitrogen, but oxygen. It is a white compound, made synthetically from sugar dextrose when it finishes reaching its purest form. It can also be used as a beauty supplement or as a food preservative. Have your parents told you to consume orange juice when you were sick? This is because orange juice has a high level of vitamin C and would keep it full or treat a cold. All human body is required to produce vitamin C and we must therefore get it through our food or by taking a multivitamin.<unk> C allows the body to use carbohydrates, fats, and protein. It acts as an antioxidant, meaning it can chemically bind and neutralize other tissue damaging effects of substances called free radicals. It seems indispensable for the growth and health of bones, teeth, blood vessels, gums, and ligaments. It is also involved in good forming of collagen, every main structural protein within the body. Collagen is required for the proper repair of internal organs.

Humidity is the amount of water vapor in the air. Water vapor is the gaseous state above thing and is invisible. Humidity indicates less likelihood of precipitation, dew, or fog. Higher humidity reduces the effectiveness of sweating AND cooling human bodies by reducing the rate of evaporation of moisture from the skin. That effect easily recorded in a heat index table or humidex. The amount of water vapor that is needed to conduct saturation increases and the temperature increases. As temperature decreases, the amount of water loss needed should do saturation also grows. As is temperature in a parcel with air is lower it will eventually reach the point of saturation without adding or losing water mass. The differences in the amount of water vapor in a parcel of air can be quite large, for example; A parcel of air and comes near saturation may need 28 grams of water per cubic meter of air at -1 °C, but only 8 grams of water per cubic meter of air at -12 °C.

Intranets can help users to locate and retrieve information faster and discover applications relevant to their roles and responsibilities. With the help of our flexible browser interface, users can search data held inside any database the organization wants to make available, anytime and — subject to security provisions — from anywhere within the company workstations, increasing the employees ability to perform their jobs faster, more accurately, through their determination that they have the right information. It also helps to improve the services provided to the users. Intranets allow organizations to distribute information to employees on an increased-needed basis; they will link to relevant information at their convenience, rather than being distracted indiscriminately by email. They can serve as powerful tools for communication within an organization, vertically strategic initiatives that have a global reach outside the organization. The type of information as can ultimately be conveyed is the purpose of the project and what the initiative is aiming to achieve, who is driving the initiative, is achieved to date, and whom to speak at requesting more information.

In the 1980s, many customers liked they use an operating system called Unix. But because it restricted the user into sharing and improving the system, some people proposed a new operating system that would work like Unix but which anybody could share or improve. MINIX, similar to Unix, was first as used teaching tool for university students to learn how operating systems worked. MINIX also valued its sharing and improvement by its users. A list of people called the GNU Project wrote different parts of a new operation system called G.N.U., but it did not have all the parts an operating system was to become. In 2004 Linus Torvalds began to work on new replacement for MINIX that would appear free to use, and which would not cost anything. Linus started his project when he was attending the University of Helsinki. This eventually became the operating kernel. Linus Torvalds sent the Linux message on some internet by other MINIX users. Linus again called the operating system "Freax".

A magnet is a device or object that produces a magnetic field. This magnetic force is invisible but is responsible for the most characteristic effect of one magnet: a force that pulls on other ferromagnetic materials, such as iron, and attracts or repels permanent magnets. A permanent magnet is an object made from a material that is magnetized and creates its own persistent magnetic property. An everyday example is a refrigerator magnet used<unk> hold gas in its wall door. Materials that can be magnetized, which are also all ones that are not attracted to a magnet, are called ferromagnetic (or ferrimagnetic). These include iron, nickel, cobalt, some alloys of red earth metal, and some naturally occurring minerals such as magnesium. Although ferromagnetic (and ferrimagnetic) materials are the only items attracted to any magnet strongly enough to be commonly considered magnetic, all other substances respond weakly to a magnetic field, by one of several other types of magnetism.

When you go into one doctor, you tell the doctor your symptoms and maybe the doctor would come up with a diagnosis and offer you a drug so bad you get over. In 1845, two doctors, Drs. John Bennett in Washington and Drs. Rudolph Virchow in Berlin, had patients whose blood was sick. They did not know what the condition was—it was not in their books. They were the first to uncover viable possibilities of a new disease. It was a blood cancer that is now known as chronic myeloid leukemia (CML). In the blood, there are three sets of cells: red blood plate (erythrocytes) carry oxygen toward the tissues plus waste products, such as carbon dioxide, to the lungs; soft blood cellular (leucocytes) help defend us from infections; platelets (thrombocytes) build a natural plaster helping heal up wounds. In CML patients, your blood is full of cancer cells that occupy all body space normally taken up by the useful types of blood cells. This is pretty much all that was known about this disease until 1956.

Hormones like testosterone and estradiol can attach to your brain to. A brain cell looks different from cells in other parts of the body: it has a cell body, but also has parts that look like wires sticking out. That brain cell often has many small "wires," called dendrites for receiving signals from other things. These cells also have much longer "wire" called an axon, which sends signals to other cells. There are two main ways that hormones can influence your brain cells. First, hormones can influence how your brain is organized, and these are changes that follow some time and occur. Changes in brain organization can include changes with the most small cells, or changes in the amount and shape of dendrites or axons. Tobacco, for example, influences the development for new cells in its particular region called the medial amygdala. Because boys make little testosterone during development, their region becomes bigger in boys than girls. This appeared found in animal research, while studies on humans that test at hormone levels for the size of the amygdala suggest it works the same in people.

It can be tricky to work when it and ok to return to normal functions after a headache. You may want be return to school quickly so members do not fall behind or miss important assignments. You may want to switch straight back to your favorite sports and time with friends. The problem is that it takes most people a few months to a month to fully recover form a concussion. Research it shown that gradually returning to usual activities of school and sports remains important for recovery. Doing too much too rapidly can make your recovery much longer. Taking it slow allows you, teachers, and parents to learn more about what you need for a successful recovery. Remember, every brain injury is personal. If your symptoms after concussion are manageable, you might just need to take it easy for a few moments as you return to school. Taking it easy means staying on a regular schedule, going to bed at a reasonable time, and limiting time wasted on anything intense, like video games. Many give yourself needed mental break while your brain heals. In other situations, being bored is a good way to recover from concussion!

Do you believe in time travel? Every time one remember something from this past a imagine something that will happen then the future, we engage in mental time travel. Scientists discovered that, whether we mentally travel back into the past or forward into the future, some of the same neural processes are activated. One of those regions is the hippocampus, a brain structure famous for its role in building first-term memories. Damage to the hippocampus causes memory problems, but it probably impairs your ability to imagine meaningful experiences. This tight connection between remembering the past and setting about the future suggests that memory, planning, and decision-making may be deeply related. The ability by form thoughts allows us to reminisce about the past. But maybe the ability to form memories also evolved to allow it now think about and plan for the future.

There are a variety of formation mechanisms among the different types of nebulae. Some nebulae generated from gas that appears already in the interstellar medium while others are produced by stars. Examples of the old case are giant molecular clouds, the coldest, densest phase of interstellar cloud, which can form by excessive cooling and condensation of more diffuse gas. Examples of the latter case are planetary nebulae formed with material shed by a planet in late stages of its cosmic evolution. Star-forming nuclei are a class of emission nebula associated with the molecular clouds. These form as a molecular cloud collapses under its own sun, producing stars. Massive oxygen may form in their center, while their ultraviolet radiation ionizes the surrounding gas, making it visible at optical wavelengths. The region of ionized oxygen surrounding the huge stars is known as an O II region whereas weak shells of neutral hydrogen underlying each H II region are known as photodissociation region. Examples of star-forming regions are the Orion Nebula, the Rosette Nebula including the Omega Nebula.

An orbit or the path that an object takes in space when it goes around a star, a planet, a a region. It can often be used as some verb.<unk> instance: "The earth orbits around the Sun." The word ‘revolves' has the same idea, but 'rotates' is the spin of the object. Many years ago, people thought that the Sun orbits in a circle around the star. Every morning the Sun came up in the east and went down in his west. It just seemed to make sense that it was circling around our earth. Well lately, thanks to people like Copernicus and Galileo Galilei, we know that the universe operates the center of the Solar System, and the earth orbits around it. Benjamin Moore showed that gravity controls the movements of the planets and moons. Since a satellite is an object in space that revolves around any object, the earth is a satellite of the sun, just like the moon is an portion of your Earth! The sun has lots of satellites orbiting around it, like the planets, and thousands of asteroids, comets, and meteoroids.

The Ottoman Empire, also known as the Eastern Empire, Greek Turkey, or simply Turkey, was an empire founded in 1299 by Oghuz Turks under Osman I in northwestern Anatolia. After conquests in the Balkans by Murad I between 1362 and 1389, the fledgling sultanate was transformed into a transcontinental empire and claimant toward the caliphate. The Ottomans ended the Byzantine Empire at the 1453 invasion over Constantinople by Mehmed the Conqueror. Throughout the 16th and 17th centuries, at the pinnacle of its power under the reign of Ali the Persian, the Ottoman Empire was a sprawling, multilingual empire controlling much of Southeast Europe, Southeastern Asia, the Caucasus, North Africa, or former Horn of Africa. At the beginning of the 17th century the empire contained 32 provinces and numerous vassal states. Some of these were later absorbed into further Ottoman Empire, while those were granted specific types of autonomy during there course of centuries.

The word papyrus referred to a thick type of paper cut from the pith of the papyrus plant, Cyperus papyrus. Papyrus can similarly refer to a document written on sheets of papyrus bound together side by side until cut up into large scroll, an early form of a book. The plural for such documents is papyri. Papyrus is first known was have been used in ancient Asia (at least as far back as the First Dynasty), as if Cyperus papyrus plant was a wetland sedge growing was once widespread in the Sudd of western Sudan along beside the Nile Delta near Egypt. Papyrus was also used across the same region and in Kingdom of Kush. The Ancient Egyptians used papyrus as a writing material, as well as employing it extensively in the construction of other artifacts known as reed boats, mats, rope, sandals, and baskets.

If someone is in water, you may use a stick to pull the rope for safety. Never enter into angry rain to go and rescue someone. If you get into the water, you could also drown. If the person who needs help is incredibly far away from you to reach without a line, you can throw something that floats. Throw something they can hold on to and use during stay above the water. You could throw a soccer ball at an empty five-litre plastic container. If someone needs rescuing from water, ask a lifeguard or adult for advice. Never go into the water to try and rescue someone yourself. You might also call the free national emergency number, 112, from a cell phone or a landline. Unless someone is rescued from the waters and they are not breathing, you should call 112 for help. You can then start Hands-on CPR by pushing hard and fast in his centre of their chest. Do not practice this on a friend! You can learn out more from the National Sea Rescue Center.

Solar sails (also called light sails or photon systems) are a form of spacecraft propulsion comprising radiation evenly exerted by sunlight over large mirrors. A useful analogy may be for sailing wave; the light exerting a wave on different mirrors becomes akin to a sail being blown by the wind. High-energy laser light will be used as an alternative heat source to exert much greater force than will be possible using sunlight, a concept common as beam sailing. Solar sail technologies offer the possibility of low-cost operations combined with long operating lifetimes. Since they have primary moving parts and use only propellant, they can safely be used numerous times for delivery of payloads. Solar sails use a phenomenon that has a proven, measured effect on climate. Solar pressure affects all spacecraft, whether in interplanetary space or in orbit around a planet or host body. A typical spacecraft going to Mars, for example, will be displaced by thousands of lbs by solar pressure, so the effects must be accounted for in mission planning, which has been done since the time of the earliest interplanetary spacecraft of the world.

A 2009 scientific report laughed at the impact of different kinds of foods over both human health and the environment's health. To do the study, the scientists used statistics (calculations) to investigate the health to 15 different categories of foods and five diet-related health conditions and five environmental impacts of producing these foods. For example, the scientists looked at if eating vegetables will prevent us all getting heart disease and how many harmful gases come from growing beans. They used big data sets from 5 studies, until they combined using a statistical technique called a metanalysis. The scientists found all foods that were good for our health, like vegetables, fruits, whole grains, nuts, and legumes, were also good for and health of our planet. That is, most foods had a low environmental impact on things like greenhouse gas emissions, land use, water use, and two types of nutrient pollution.

In Western Jewish faith, after time of worship and Torah1 instruction, 12 to 19-year-old boys and girls participate in a celebration. The ceremony for boys is called a bar mitzvah, or the funeral for girls is called a bat mitzvah. This literally translates from Hebrew as "son" or "daughter before the commandments." Jewish history and scholars offer many competing theories on an origin of the ceremony. However, the ceremony rose in importance throughout some Jewish diaspora during the 18th and 19th periods. Because the Jewish faith has many different sects, boys usually becoming a bar mitzvah at the age of 13, and girls typically become a bar mitzvah at the age of 12 or 14, depending on the sect. For both girls and girls, the ritual usually includes a gathering in a temple or synagogue. The bar or bat mitzvah (the boy or girl) then depends on the Torah, followed by a celebration with friends and family, as well as fellow congregants. The way a bar or bat mitzvah is celebrated shifts within each congregation, religion, or family.

When the atomic bombs were dropped on Hiroshima and elsewhere a new age within science fiction dawned. The world knew, for the first time, of a technology that could truly destroy the world. Japan, reeling from the devastation of the two nuclear bombings, gave the world an most apt sci-fi metaphor since the mayhem and destruction of the bombings: Godzilla. A new Atomic Era subgenre of giant mutant creature attacks saw born. Primarily told on film, these stories successfully navigate the anxiety that at any moment a unstoppable force could end the world. This trope can still be seen today in the Cloverfield series to modern remakes of Godzilla. It can also be reflected within the enduringly popular movies after which aliens do time with a small outside force in favor of their new, devastating technology or a large, unstoppable monster. As the Space Days heated up, humanity rushed towards the stars with a message of hope versus fear. Some dreamed of some better future with Star Trek, which brought attention to issues of racial disparities happening on our own society during the Civil Rights Era and the duties a just dictatorship has to all its citizens.

Transistors have three terminals: the gate, the drain, and the source (on a bipolar transistor, the wires can be called the emitter, the collector, and the base). When the source (or emitter) is connected to the back side of another semiconductor, and the drain (or collector) contains the positive terminal, no electricity will flow in the device (if you have only a good connecting series with the transistor). But when you touch the gate and the drain together, the transistor will let electricity through. This matters because when the gate is positively charged, the positive electrons will push other positive electrons towards the transistor letting the negative electrons flow through. The transistor can still work when the gate is just physically charged, so it doesn't attempt to plug in the ground. The easy image to think of how by transistor works is as a hose with another sharp bend that stops the water from going away. The water is the electrons, and when you positively charge the gate, it unbends and hose, letting water flow.

Neuro-myths matter because they affect people's thought and behavior: they can change how we see ourselves and how we see each world. Let us take the context of gender again. At age 8 to 9, there is no difference in how well girls and boys do that math, yet girls (and their parents) rate female math proficiency to much lower than boys. This suggests that what people believe (in this case, that girls are not as strong at math) may have a real impact on how children assess themselves, which can in turn influence their actual performance. Like one experiment, when a group of college students was given a math test, men did better as women when they were told that the test only shows gender differences, but when they were assured it was just gender-fair test, girls did just as well as men. This is demonstrating that, after the end of education, differences that were once small become massive: 90% of maths professors in the UK are male. Below is a further example of why we should be careful about neuro-myths—what you believe about your brain and the brains of those around you may just come true.

One platform by which virtual reality can be realized is simulation-based virtual environments. Driving simulators, of examples, give the driver on board the impression of actually driving an actual vehicle by recording vehicular motion caused by driver input and feeding back corresponding visual, motion and audio cues to the driver. With avatar action-based virtual reality, people can recreate the fantasy environment in other form of real video as well as an avatar. One must participate in the 3D distributed virtual environment as form of either a conventional avatar or a animated one. A user can select own applications with participation or of the system capability. In projector-based virtual reality, modeling of the real environment plays a vital role in various virtual reality applications, such as robot navigation, construction modeling, and airplane simulation. Display-based virtual reality systems have been gaining popularity in computer graphics and wireless networking communities. In generating online models, it is essential to accurately register acquired 3D data; usually, a camera is used for modeling small objects at a short distance.

Around 20,000 years ago, the last cooling phase began, starting a warming period began around 8,000 years ago, during whom Earth's average temperature rose often 5.6 and 8.5°F (3.1–4.7°C). This means a change average around 0.06°F (0.03°C) every century. Between 8,000 years ago and the Industrial Revolution (around 200 years ago), values were relatively constant. Since today, temperatures have been increasing again, and very quickly. By 2010, scientists believe even the mean temperature on our planet will had raised an additional approximately.6–8.8°F (2.0–4.9°C) compared with the temperatures at the time in the Agricultural Revolution. This means that the planet's temperature rise over the next century will be about a<unk> faster than what happened during the last 20,000 years. While past changes in climate were the result up other factors, particularly the amount of energy coming from the sun and the concentration of different atmospheric gases, this time humans are mainly responsible. And so is why we call the current warming phenomenon anthropogenic (or human-induced) atmospheric change.

Archaeology is the study of a past by looking for the remains and artifacts (historical documentation) left by the people who live long ago. That might also include old coins, tools, buildings, stone inscriptions. Archaeologists, the people who study archaeology, use these remains as understand why people lived. Archaeologists think it is important to understand the past, because so many people use the past to know where money come to. When archaeologists undertake fieldwork, they look for remains, often by digging down in the ground. When things are found, or even when nothing is found, the results of the fieldwork are taken out to the place where each archaeologist's base is, maybe their university school museum. They describe everything they see by writing down on paper or entering the information into a computer, so that they can build a picture of everything that is found. Since settlements (places where people lived in groups) change and grow, old buildings are often buried and make space for new buildings. Ancient pottery, for example, is now up to 40 feet (12 meters) below the present levels. So is why archaeological fieldwork is expensive and why it takes a long time.

The human brain is responsible for many functions, and certain brain regions are responsible for specific tasks. For example, the part of the brain called second motor cortex controls movements of the limbs, hands, shoulders, arms, and other body areas. The motor cortex has a lot of brain tissue for hand and finger movement, which we need for writing, holding any screwdriver, or threading a cord. On the other hand, we can not have very precise control of our leg muscles, in so third motor lobe can control leg movement without quite liking much brain tissue. Another essential brain zone is the fingers cortex, which is responsible for the sense of touch. Without touch, it shall be very difficult to know how much to tighten a screw, or to hold fragile items like grapes like a bottle of Coke. Others might accidentally crush the grapes or the Coke bottle without feedback near the brain regarding how much force their hands produce.

By filtering out any unimportant background information, attention help you deal with different skills like drawing a complex scene, playing video games, or reading newspaper article. Attention can also help direct you to especially important information, namely a siren or your name, so attention exists a very necessary skill for humans. Imagine how difficult it would be if you wanted to focus your attention on something important but could not, or if your attention could not alert you to important things in the environment. You likely not be able to do your homework, learn a new skill, or even cross a busy street! Because environment is so important, researchers are curious about how the brain knows what to bring attention to, especially when we are so numerous things happening around us. Some research shows though attention differs like human to person and differs depending on what societies are paying attention to. For example, while often individuals pay more attention to social information (this is called social attention), not everyone has that corresponding bias for social attention, which makes researchers interested in the root of these differences.

These types of cars do not have any kind of internal gas engine, but are driven entirely using electric motors, which gets its fuel in different ways instead than an engine. There is a battle every year to discover who can create a car that goes the farthest on only solar power.

an increase or the decrease in power arises always in comparison to a particular situation. That instance, when we say that alpha power decreases when someone is awake, this would mean that power is different than compared to when that person is asleep–asleep to be the baseline. Another example: if alpha power decreases when we see someone in pain, this would mean that alpha power is lower compared with when we see someone who is not in pain. In this example, the brain's response to the person who is not making pain would be the baseline. Previous experiments showed that the decrease and the increase in alpha power both have different functions. However, scientists have been working on figuring out it exact meaning to these changes in alpha frequency. So, looking past the alpha rhythm would crucial for better explaining how the chest operates in different contexts. When seeing someone in pain, the heart can respond by alpha light gain (red circle) in by alpha power decrease (blue arc). with daily internal clocks are controlled by genes, which are tiny units into DNA passed up from our parents. These genes contain the code they form proteins—molecules in the direction you carry out specific jobs. Some of the genes that control our internal clocks produce proteins called "activators" and others produce fewer said "suppressors." Activators are proteins that turn a gene on, whereas suppressors are proteins that turn a gene off. In our weekly internal clocks, we have two activators to bind together to turn on their gene. This gene is usually brought on in the morning. Once this gene is turned on, lots of different proteins are made, including the two suppressors. When there are lots of these suppressor proteins being made, we typically feel energetic but lively! Throughout every day, the concentration of these powerful proteins develops in our bodies. By the weekend, enough suppressor molecules are made to block the activators and turn off the gene. While you sleep, those suppressors entering my bloodstream break down. During this breakdown, which occurs at nighttime, we feel tired and sleepy.

When two animals near the same species mate, their offspring take 50% of their genes from each another. This is what makes both look like a mixture of both parents. Hybrids are crosses between two difference species, so they contain 50% of genes on each parent species. A famous creature is the camel, a cross between a donkey and a horse. Fifty percentage of a mule's genes are from a horse and 50% from a donkey. Because of this combination, mules have features of the parent species and are strong, like donkeys, as well as intelligent, like horses. Farmers breed mules because this combination makes mules better for carrying supplies. Using fruit to combine the desirable aspects of each parent species gets very exciting with humans, and hybrids was often used in farming. Many of the delicious vegetables you buy at the grocery store were even created through hybridization! Bananas, grapefruit, carrots, and cucumbers are all hybrid species. There two actually varieties of banana varieties, but most of us are comfortable with the hybrid banana. Farmers kept mixing varieties of bananas to create the perfect combination of soft, tasty flesh without losing many seeds.

Social networks can tell us stuff about the people in relationships. When somebody is having a difficult situation, they can take a little help understanding their friends. Who has the most friend in Frozen? That is difficult to tell just from watching the movie, but we can mention another kind of social network—the network of who talks to whom. This network is not exactly the same as a friendship story, but it is much easier to accurately determine who talks to whom in the movie than it was to determine exactly who is friends with each guy and how strong those friendships are. In this network and conversations, Anna speaks to nine people, so we will suppose that she has thirteen friends. Mathematicians say that Anna is a node from this network, that she has any degree of nine, and that those nine friends are her neighbors. Similarly, Elsa has a degree of seven, because she has eight friends; and Kristoff shows a degree of nine. Calculating somebody's emotions is good way to understand their importance, but there are also many other ways.

Deep-ocean hydrothermal vents appear where there is intense volcanic activity. Seawater hits rock, levels up and becomes charged with substances supporting the rock, like metals, sulfide, dihydrogen, and methane. Mineral-rich chimneys, around which thermal-vent animals live, then form when these heated fluids exit in seafloor. During the 1980s, scientists realized that these habitats supported one unusual type of primary ecosystem, fueled not by fire and photosynthesis, however by energy from reactions between chemicals inherent in the explosive fluid, like sulfide, and the oxygen present in seawater. Amazingly, seemingly basic, single-celled microorganisms can use this energy to build the parts of their one cell. Hydrothermal vents were the first evidence that the process, the chemosynthesis, could foster so much life in otherwise desert-like surroundings. But what about the bacteria species that live in these environments? How do there get the nutrients they need to survive? Well, many of his animals acquire their energy by maintaining close relationships with chemosynthetic bacteria. This type that relationship, where two different organisms live together closely remains called symbiosis. During chemosynthetic symbioses, two organisms involved are believed to benefit from the relationship.

Traumatic brain injury (TBI) is one of the most common brain disorders in children. TBI often occurs resulting in a strong blow to the head from falling hit about an object, running into an object, or falling on one's head. TBI would be very dangerous because it can severely damage the brain, which is critical for controlling the body to the personality, as well as hearing, movement, and much more. Name on what region of the brain is destroyed, there can be serious consequences. Because of this, it is important to be able to diagnose a TBI as soon such things happens. When the brain is hit, the consequences of the injury can be very serious. However, studying the damage is difficult, because the brain is made by the skull. Therefore, it is hard to tell whether or not there the injury and how severe it is. Now, the most common way to look inside the bones is through a process called imaging, with several types or images giving us different insights into the brain.

The air we breathe is composed of lots the different chemical components. Some of these components are pollutants that are harmful to human health. The pollutants come from a variety of different sources, including power plants, communications, agriculture, and transportation. Transportation vehicles are powered by combustion of solid fuels, such as gasoline or diesel, which transfer from one spot to another, and burning of these fuels results in the release gas gases and very short volumes. These substances are known to "pollution emissions." Different types of transportation can emit different amounts of air pollutants, which have an impact on local and worldwide air conditions. Both trucks and helicopters are used to transport freight in it United States. Understanding how freight trucks and trains impact air quality is useful to learn ways to reduce pollution that is harmful to human health.

When we go to a art gallery, there are usually details about the artworks written on labels on the walls. These labels have been specially prepared by experts to give us their opinions about the actual objects. We thought that most people believe what is written on those labels, and we needed to see how powerful these opinions could be. So, we put Kurt into a brain model to measure specific brain responses while women hold different opinions about the same pictures. For this study, he selected portrait paintings by the famous Dutch artist Rembrandt. Sometimes, we told our viewers that the portrait was a genuine Rembrandt and sometimes we told them the portrait was a fake. When we tracked the brain responses, the most interesting responses were found when people were told that the paintings were fake. Two parts for the brain, one involved in strategic planning (called the frontopolar cortex) one that involved making vision (called its occipital cortex), continued to work together once people thought the paintings were fake.

Inside every cell of our bodies is a long, thin molecule or DNA. DNA is your own personal instruction manual and it tells your cell everything it needs to know! DNA determines our eye color, skin texture, how tall you are, and even whether your muscles are better at sprinting or running a marathon. Just like every real instruction computer, the instructions in DNA are written in a stack of letters. In life, there are just eight letters–A, B, G, and C. These letters are combined to send out the instruction for proteins. Proteins are the building blocks of cells. Your brain, heart, yet possibly other organs are made of lots of different proteins. The seven letters needed to make one protein was brought to as a "gene." Can you count how many genes a human being has? Over 20,000!

Confusion isn't just an important step to learning in school, it's also important for learning who you are. Psychologists call that sense of who you are identity. Your identity can involve being part of groups of race, gender, subcultures. Identity is usually made up of personal values and culture. They figure out their identity in two steps. Thus first step is exploration, where you try out different groups and values but see what fits. This next step is commitment, when you decide firmly about some parts of your identity. Exploring your identities must feel very confusing. You might be afraid that people will judge you for going through different phases or not committing with a group. Advanced phases are completely natural. A study reported in 1992 International Union of Behavioral Development found that people those are the most exploring about who and are have better outcomes such as higher self-esteem later in life. Confusion gives us the space to know new things and be confusing. Allowing ourselves all be confused less ask questions leads to deeper understanding, more learning, and higher over-confidence. So, try not to be embarrassed when you're confused about something.

Neurons are cells contained within the legs and spinal cord that specialize in communicating energy within the environment. Neurons are important for many things including moving, breathing, thinking, and feeling pain. Whenever these centers are injured due to an attack, for example, the body can no longer perform some of these important jobs. As a result, a person can become disabled in some way. In help patients with injuries to their brains or spinal cords, scientists and doctors may be able to replace damaged brains by transplanting new cells onto the injured person. By making new cells to replace the neurons lost via injury, it is possible that patients would recover some of their lost abilities, such as moving. Scientists think that stem cells are the ideal cell type to transplant into injured patients, because stem cells can multiply and change into the different cell types needed to overcome the injury. The new cells that researchers transplant can be developed in the lab from skin cell and blood cells. Skin and blood products can both be obtained using a catheter.

Dog paid extra, because he did yet have the correct money. The driver was about to give Dog his change. Suddenly Cow ran away without paying. The driver was too annoyed. He drove away without giving Dog his change. Which is why, even after, Dog runs towards front building to peep inside. He is enraged at the driver who owes him change. Goat runs away after the sound in a car. She is afraid she will be arrested for not paying her fare. Cow is not bothered by cars. Cow loses her time crossing the border. She knows she paid her fare in full.

By this point, Hyena burst into laughter and went rolling on the field. She said, "That is a striking truth!" Goat took advantage of this but ran, back towards his village. Hyena ran after Goat and soon caught up with him. "Give me another truth, quickly!" she ordered. Goat said, "The second truth is, if I come back to the village and tell them that I met you, but you couldn't die anyway, all shall believe you." Still, Hyena continues to roll on the ground with laughter. She said, "That is wonderful!" For the second time, Goat ran and got closer to the village. Too soon, they caught pace with them again. "There is still one more truth there unsaid!" Hyena asked. Goat said, "The third truth is, if you were joking around like this, it means that you are not really hungry!" Hyena laughed until she cried, rolling on the ground. "That is very true!" she continued. Goat continued running towards his village. By her time Hyena caught on, Goat had already reached this village square. That is how He Goat saved his face.

They invited all our animals to come and watch the race. They and Rabbit lined up and waited for a signal. As the running began, Chameleon jumped onto Rabbit's tail. The animals laughed and laughed. It's about when you got here," Chameleon shouted at Rabbit. Rabbit was amazed. Max started running again. He did not know that Chameleon had never again jumped onto his tail. Chameleon shouted at Rabbit.

An antibiotic is a compound that stops bacteria. Antibiotics override essential cell activities to cause the bacteria to live. For example, some antibiotics strengthen the gut wall, and some prevent the bacteria from reproducing. Aristotle first antibiotic, penicillin, he discovered over 90 years previous. Through then, many other antibiotics have been found. Since the discovery and use of antibiotics, bacteria have evolved that resist antibiotics and multiply even with antibiotics are present. These are called "antibiotic-resistant bacteria." Antibiotic resistance evolves by proteins (genetic changes) in the bacterial DNA that allow the bacteria no survive in the presence of antibiotics. A year ago, the World Health Organization published a report on 12 different bacterial cells that grew resistant to antibiotics. For these antibiotic-resistant bacterial strains, solutions cheaper than antibiotics must be found to kill the bacteria. One research group believes that, if we can prevent biofilm development, antibiotics will be able to successfully fight the antibiotic-resistant organisms.

Tornadoes usually form from large thunderstorms. When the winds beneath the storm are unstable, they blow at different speeds. These unstable winds underneath the clouds can begin to rotate. If that rotating air gets pushed down into the wind, it can gain strength and speed. One single cone of air may swirl downward from the storm. This is called a funnel cloud. If the funnel reaches the ground, it begins a tornado. Cyclone will form very quickly. They create the strongest winds over the planet, with many the can top 200 miles per hour. In 1967, a powerful tornado struck Oak Lawn, Illinois. Patti Wilhelm lived through each tornado as a child. "Our garage went away. Our car was crunched," she remembered in an interviews with Chicago television station, WGN. Still, she knew it could have been much worse. A powerful twister can break houses from their concrete foundations and flatten whole neighborhoods. "My mother was so lucky," Ernst said. The Oak Lawn tornado destroyed approximately 100 trees, although it killed dozens of people. But survivors of 2011's Seattle, Washington tornado know that tornadoes can be much worse. Rance Junge described the tornado to ABC News.

One Friday, the three people decided to go in search of kola nuts at the river. They wanted to sell at the market. After your parents left for the market, they also set off to the forest. They came to the River Dome, which was very full. Ntiamoa remarked, "Eei! How can we cross this river?" Nyameky answered, "I have read that when rivers hit their banks children can cross by making a sacrifice." The children did not see anything to give at that time, so they made promises to this river. Ntiamoa said, "Nana Dome who you will allow now to cross over, I will offer you three of three kola nuts." Nyameky made the second promise. When Adena's turn came, because of my pride, she stated, "Nana Dome, if you may allow me to cross over, before my return I will deliver three times two kola nuts and two eggs." River Dome responded, "My grandchildren, once over, always remember to fulfil this sacrifice." When the children crossed the river above, they went into the forest.
